intro: Restio setuligerus, commonly known as the slender restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with slender, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found in fynbos vegetation. Restio setuligerus is adapted to dry conditions and is typically found in well-drained soils.
